column4: Ubuntu does these mounts in the /etc/init/mount* files, but you shouldn't change these files.  Like ilovefairuz said, /etc/fstab is the right place to create new mounts on an Ubuntu system.  Doing things the BSD-way can break the system.
Use the mounted-varrun file as a template.  Try not to change existing files.  If you don't understand this file, then you need to read the "upstart" documentation.
